5_156xbcM9BrbdhtYZUPAQBFvLDGGyy5AjdM.body:
well zeronet supports .bit which is a form of decentralized DNS. So as long as it can reach the tracker then it can take off from there.

Actually a better method to solve the problem with reaching the tracker would be to either give zeronet full support for DHT or to use a similar method to i2p in where we download a list of IPs and then have zeronet try and bootstrap from an IP that is already connected to the zeronet network.

1_1V9s3bTqEto41K25tqvTfmhS9t1nFCYSF.body: I've heard of people that have gotten past the 2nd or 3rd challenge.

2_17ac9ybVj5CtUpBvi5NeP1EwNZjfJoZWvt.body:
people seem to like matrix.org (its like webRTC and more). You can also try ring on android its FOSS and P2P.

What more features do you want from a p2p chat service? live video/audio is like telling the spooks where the hell you live anyways.
